main.name: Pavlin Atanasov
main.description: Web Development Engineer with experience building responsive, user-focused web applications and supporting deployment workflows. Hands-on experience configuring and maintaining automated build pipelines, integrating unit and automation tests, and implementing static code analysis within the development lifecycle. Interested in automation, system reliability, and improving release processes. Eager to grow into a DevOps Engineer role and further develop infrastructure and operational expertise
main.bio: I am a dedicated Web Development Engineer with strong communication skills and excellent verbal abilities. I thrive in collaborative team environments, contributing my expertise while also being able to manage responsibilities and make informed decisions when needed. Known for being a conscientious, fast learner, I quickly adapt to new challenges and technologies. I have a keen ability to assess organizational needs and translate them into robust, complementary web solutions that enhance online presence and user experience.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description:
Design, develop, and maintain frontend components of payment processing systems, delivering solutions integrated with financial institutions and third-party services. Contribute to infrastructure and release processes by maintaining and enhancing automated build and deployment pipelines using Jenkins and GitHub Actions. Manage workflow configurations, integrate unit and automation tests into pipelines, and perform application deployments, using GitHub for version control and team collaboration. 
Act as a Security Champion within the team, embedding security practices into development workflows by integrating scanning and code quality tools such as Snyk and SonarQube, and monitoring solutions like EdgeScan. 
Participate in on-call rotation, supporting production systems, monitoring transaction integrity, and resolving incidents to ensure high availability and operational stability. Additionally, working with Linux environments, including shell scripting and tools such as Vim to support automation and system tasks.
